title: Get started
code: datafile <- system.file("nyc_squirrels_sample.csv", package = "autonomy.ch") nyc_squirrels <- read.csv(datafile)  check_data_integrity(nyc_squirrels,'primary_fur_color') #> [1] "Dataset is OK" #check_data_integrity(nyc_squirrels,'combination_of_primary_and_highlight_color')

title: Build A Package From Rmarkdown File
text: basic examples show check_data_integrity working

title: Build A Package From Rmarkdown File
code: library(autonomy.ch)  datafile <- system.file("nyc_squirrels_sample.csv", package = "autonomy.ch") nyc_squirrels <- read.csv(datafile)  # ok: data is an existing data.frame, colname exists, data in column is OK check_data_integrity(data = nyc_squirrels, colname = 'primary_fur_color') #> [1] "Dataset is OK"

what: These lines return an explicit error:
title: Build A Package From Rmarkdown File
code: library(autonomy.ch)  #error: not a data.frame check_data_integrity(data = NULL, colname = 'combination_of_primary_and_highlight_color') #> Error: data is not a data frame  datafile <- system.file("nyc_squirrels_sample.csv", package = "autonomy.ch") nyc_squirrels <- read.csv(datafile)  #error: not an existing column check_data_integrity(data = nyc_squirrels, colname = 'not_existing_col') #> Error: not_existing_col does not exist in data  #error: detecting forbidden pattern in existing column check_data_integrity(data = nyc_squirrels, colname = 'combination_of_primary_and_highlight_color') #> Error: forbidden pattern detected in combination_of_primary_and_highlight_color
